00025 #ifndef _RTAI_MQ_H
00026 #define _RTAI_MQ_H
00027 
00028 #include <rtai_sem.h>
00029 
00030 #define MQ_OPEN_MAX     8       /* Maximum number of message queues per process */
00031 #define MQ_PRIO_MAX     32      /* Maximum number of message priorities */
00032 #define MQ_BLOCK        0       /* Flag to set queue into blocking mode */
00033 #define MQ_NONBLOCK     1       /* Flag to set queue into non-blocking mode */
00034 #define MQ_NAME_MAX     80      /* Maximum length of a queue name string */
00035 
00036 #define MQ_MIN_MSG_PRIORITY 0           /* Lowest priority message */
00037 #define MQ_MAX_MSG_PRIORITY MQ_PRIO_MAX /* Highest priority message */
00038 
00039 #define MAX_PQUEUES     4       /* Maximum number of message queues in module */
00040 #define MAX_MSGSIZE     50      /* Maximum message size per queue (bytes) */
00041 #define MAX_MSGS        10      /* Maximum number of messages per queue */
00042 #define MAX_BLOCKED_TASKS 10    /* Maximum number of tasks blocked on a */
00043                                 /* queue at any one time  */
00044 #define MSG_HDR_SIZE    16      /* Note that this is hard-coded (urgh!) ensure */
00045                                 /*  it always matches pqueues sizeof(MSG_HDR) */ 
00046                                 /*  or do it a better way! (sic) */
00047 typedef enum {
00048     FIFO_BASED,
00049     PRIORITY_BASED
00050 } QUEUEING_POLICY;
00051 
00052 typedef enum {
00053     POSIX,
00054     VxWORKS
00055 } QUEUE_TYPE;
00056 
00057 typedef struct mq_attr {
00058     long mq_maxmsg;             /* Maximum number of messages in queue */
00059     long mq_msgsize;            /* Maximum size of a message (in bytes) */
00060     long mq_flags;              /* Blocking/Non-blocking behaviour specifier */
00061     long mq_curmsgs;            /* Number of messages currently in queue */
00062 } MQ_ATTR;
00063 
00064 typedef unsigned long mqd_t;
00065 
00066 #define INVALID_PQUEUE  0
00067 
00068 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00069 
00070 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_MQ_BUILTIN
00071 #define MQ_INIT_MODULE     mq_init_module
00072 #define MQ_CLEANUP_MODULE  mq_cleanup_module
00073 #else  /* !CONFIG_RTAI_MQ_BUILTIN */
00074 #define MQ_INIT_MODULE     init_module
00075 #define MQ_CLEANUP_MODULE  cleanup_module
00076 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_MQ_BUILTIN */

00078 #ifndef __cplusplus
00079 
00080 typedef int mq_bool_t;
00081 
00082 #ifndef TRUE
00083 #define TRUE 1
00084 #define FALSE 0
00085 #endif
00086 
00087 typedef struct msg_hdr {
00088     mq_bool_t in_use;
00089     size_t size;                /* Actual message size */
00090     uint priority;              /* Usage priority (message/task) */
00091     void *next;                 /* Pointer to next message on queue */
00092 } MSG_HDR;
00093 
00094 typedef struct queue_control {
00095     void *base;         /* Pointer to the base of the queue in memory */
00096     void *head;         /* Pointer to the element at the front of the queue */
00097     void *tail;         /* Pointer to the element at the back of the queue */
00098     MQ_ATTR attrs;      /* Queue attributes */
00099 } Q_CTRL;
00100 
00101 typedef struct msg {
00102     MSG_HDR hdr;
00103     char data;          /* Anchor point for message data */
00104 } MQMSG;
00105 
00106 struct notify {
00107     RT_TASK *task;
00108     struct sigevent data;
00109 };
00110 
00111 typedef struct _pqueue_descr_struct {
00112     RT_TASK *owner;             /* Task that created the queue */
00113     int open_count;             /* Count of the number of tasks that have */
00114                                 /*  'opened' the queue for access */
00115     char q_name[MQ_NAME_MAX];   /* Name supplied for queue */
00116     uint q_id;                  /* Queue Id (index into static list of queues) */
00117     mq_bool_t marked_for_deletion;      /* Queue can be deleted once all tasks have  */
00118                                 /*  closed it   */
00119     Q_CTRL data;                /* Data queue (real messages) */
00120     mode_t permissions;         /* Permissions granted by creator (ugo, rwx) */
00121     struct notify notify;       /* Notification data (empty -> !empty) */
00122     SEM emp_cond;               /* For blocking on empty queue */
00123     SEM full_cond;              /* For blocking on full queue */
00124     SEM mutex;                  /* For synchronisation of queue */
00125 } MSG_QUEUE;
00126 
00127 struct _pqueue_access_data {
00128     int q_id;
00129     int oflags;                 /* Queue access permissions & blocking spec */
00130 };
00131 
00132 typedef struct _pqueue_access_struct {
00133     RT_TASK *this_task;
00134     int n_open_pqueues;
00135     struct _pqueue_access_data q_access[MQ_OPEN_MAX];
00136 } *QUEUE_CTRL;
00137 
00138 typedef enum {
00139     FOR_READ,
00140     FOR_WRITE
00141 } Q_ACCESS;
00142 
00143 /*
00144  * a) A single Posix queue ( (MAX_MSGSIZE + sizeof(MSG_HDR) * MAX_MSGS) ) or 
00145  * b) A blocked tasks queue (MAX_BLOCKED_TASKS * sizeof(MSG_HDR) ) or
00146  * c) A Zentropix application data staging structure (sizeof(Z_APPS))
00147  * 
00148  * It is assumed that the first two are both bigger than a Z_APPS structure
00149  * and so the choice is made between a) and b).
00150  *
00151  * Note that one control mechanism is used to allocate memory 'chunks' for a
00152  * number of different application uses. This means that if the 'chunk' size
00153  * becomes large in relation to the amount of memory required by one or other
00154  * of these applications, memory usage becomes wasteful.
00155  *
00156  * Set of pointers to Application-Specific extensions to RTAI
00157  * such as POSIX Threads, POSIX Queues, VxWorks Compatibility Library, etc
00158  */
00159 
00160 typedef struct z_apps {
00161     int in_use_count;   // Incremented whenever an application is initialised
00162     void *pthreads;
00163     void *pqueues;
00164     void *vxtasks;
00165                         // anticipate... pclocks, psosTasks,
00166 } Z_APPS;
00167

00238 #define MQIDX  0

00243 
00244 RTAI_PROTO(mqd_t, mq_open,(char *mq_name, int oflags, mode_t permissions, struct mq_attr *mq_attr))
00245 {
00246         struct {char *mq_name; int oflags; mode_t permissions; struct mq_attr *mq_attr; int namesize, attrsize; } arg = { mq_name, oflags, permissions, mq_attr, strlen(mq_name) + 1, sizeof(struct mq_attr) };
00247         return (mqd_t)rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_OPEN, &arg).i[LOW];
00248 }
00249 
00250 RTAI_PROTO(size_t, mq_receive,(mqd_t mq, char *msg_buffer, size_t buflen, unsigned int *msgprio))
00251 {
00252         struct { mqd_t mq; char *msg_buffer; size_t buflen; unsigned int *msgprio; } arg = { mq, msg_buffer, buflen, msgprio };
00253         return (size_t)rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_RECEIVE, &arg).i[LOW];
00254 }
00255 
00256 RTAI_PROTO(int, mq_send,(mqd_t mq, const char *msg, size_t msglen, unsigned int msgprio))
00257 {
00258         struct { mqd_t mq; const char *msg; size_t msglen; unsigned int msgprio; } arg = { mq, msg, msglen, msgprio };
00259         return rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_SEND, &arg).i[LOW];
00260 }
00261 
00262 RTAI_PROTO(int, mq_close,(mqd_t mq))
00263 {
00264         struct { mqd_t mq; } arg = { mq };
00265         return rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_CLOSE, &arg).i[LOW];
00266 }
00267 
00268 RTAI_PROTO(int, mq_getattr,(mqd_t mq, struct mq_attr *attrbuf))
00269 {
00270         struct { mqd_t mq; struct mq_attr *attrbuf; int attrsize; } arg = { mq, attrbuf, sizeof(struct mq_attr) };
00271         return rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_GETATTR, &arg).i[LOW];
00272 }
00273 
00274 RTAI_PROTO(int, mq_setattr,(mqd_t mq, const struct mq_attr *new_attrs, struct mq_attr *old_attrs))
00275 {
00276         struct { mqd_t mq; const struct mq_attr *new_attrs; struct mq_attr *old_attrs; int attrsize; } arg = { mq, new_attrs, old_attrs, sizeof(struct mq_attr) };
00277         return rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_SETATTR, &arg).i[LOW];
00278 }
00279 
00280 RTAI_PROTO(int, mq_notify,(mqd_t mq, const struct sigevent *notification))
00281 {
00282         struct { mqd_t mq; const struct sigevent *notification; int size; } arg = { mq, notification, sizeof(struct sigevent) };
00283         return rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_NOTIFY, &arg).i[LOW];
00284 }
00285 
00286 RTAI_PROTO(int, mq_unlink,(char *mq_name))
00287 {
00288         struct { char *mq_name; int size; } arg = { mq_name, strlen(mq_name) + 1};
00289         return rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_UNLINK, &arg).i[LOW];
00290 }
00291 
00292 RTAI_PROTO(size_t, mq_timedreceive,(mqd_t mq, char *msg_buffer, size_t buflen, unsigned int *msgprio, const struct timespec *abstime))
00293 {
00294         struct { mqd_t mq; char *msg_buffer; size_t buflen; unsigned int *msgprio; const struct timespec *abstime; int size; } arg = { mq, msg_buffer, buflen, msgprio, abstime, sizeof(struct timespec) };
00295         return (size_t)rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_TIMEDRECEIVE, &arg).i[LOW];
00296 }
00297 
00298 RTAI_PROTO(int, mq_timedsend,(mqd_t mq, const char *msg, size_t msglen, unsigned int msgprio, const struct timespec *abstime))
00299 {
00300         struct { mqd_t mq; const char *msg; size_t msglen; unsigned int msgprio; const struct timespec *abstime; int size; } arg = { mq, msg, msglen, msgprio, abstime, sizeof(struct timespec) };
00301         return rtai_lxrt(MQIDX, SIZARG, MQ_TIMEDSEND, &arg).i[LOW];
00302 }
